TopicTitle: Lander Cans: They Need A Little Love!

Articles.Content:
I've become increasingly disatisfied with the stock selection of lander cans. I've become equally disatisfied with the apparent overweight and under-manned nature of some certain stock 2.5m lander cans. (Ahem.)

I think they need a little love. I think we need some more options here. Perhaps a tweak here and there. Two single cans weigh in at 1.32t; the two-man weighs a hefty and bloated 2.66t. Why is this? I get that it has slightly more RCS and battery power, but there isn't even an RTG or anything like that.

And with needing to actually land and plant flags with my entire ship crew, I now need a way to land three Kerbals at a time -- and the stock 3-man pod weighs 4.12t. It's a lot lighter to use 3 one-man cans, but it's also a lot uglier and more ungainly.

Two discussion questions: 

1. If you could buff or nerf the lander cans, what would you do?

2. If you were designing a new one, what features would you include, and at what weight?

Moving this over to Suggestions and Development Discussion, as it's more of a "What would you change if you could?" question than a "How do I use these parts as they are?" question ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I'd say that the multi-kerbal cans have to come down in mass.

It makes no sense to have the mass/capacity increasing with capacity and if the 1 man cans get much bigger, probes will become so much more efficient than kerbals that you'd be crazy not to use them. Maybe 1.2t for 2 man 1.25m pod and 1.7t for a 3 man 1.25-2.5m pod.

Considering that a 4 man mk2 crew cabin weighs 2 tonnes, and a 16 man mk3 cabin weighs 6.5t I don't think that's so unreasonably low.

My biggest complaint with these lander cans is that they have slightly different diameters than the size they are supposed to be. If you place the 2-man can on top of a processing lab or hitchhiker storage, you can't use the built in ladder rungs to climb to the next part - it's off by just enough to be really annoying.

So much this.

^^^ good point about the diameter. I'd hope that the impact and reentry tolerance could be made such that lander cans are not atmospheric things. I suppose the mk2 right now might be tougher for that reason, hence the mass, but I'd really like to see a better way to integrate landers into stacks with interstage fairings with no bulge.

[I made a thread on this](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/110822-Should-Lander-Cans-be-nerfed-for-1-0) a month ago, just for the curious as to what the people have said already. It also includes my take on things, based on the things I've noticed upon comparing lander cans to the Apollo LM.

That has not been my experience, or at least, not entirely. Climbing down from the 2-man landercan to a Hitchhiker or a science lab that's attached to its bottom works fine. I've been doing that on my Cheddar-class landers since 0.18.

> ![screenshot461.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/4057920/Kerbal%20Space%20Program/v0.90/Screenshots/screenshot461.png)

Climbing up from a Landercan to a Hitchiker or a science lab attached to the top of the landercan, however does not; I'd just assumed that Squad didn't make the landercan so its ladder extended above the door.
I may have been thinking of the viewing cuppola instead of the lander can, it was one or both of those I had trouble with before.

Thanks for the move.

I really am thinking the 2.5m can needs to be a lot lighter. And, once we get the upgraded aero (and re-entry heat?), the temperature tolerance and crash resistance needs to be nerfed bigtime.

I'm actually a bit surprised that more modders haven't created new ones, given the limitations of the stock parts. I would have expected lighter and/or higher crew capacity parts to have been created already. If I could do it myself I would. Perhaps now is a good time to learn, right? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
